intro: Lacistema bolivianum, commonly known as the Bolivian moonflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a climbing vine that produces large, fragrant white flowers that open at night. The plant belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped blooms. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. The flowers emit a sweet scent that attracts nocturnal pollinators such as moths.
